canonical_explanation.text: A line extends in both directions without end. A ray starts at a point and extends in one direction. A line segment has two endpoints. Parallel lines never meet. Perpendicular lines meet at a right angle (90 degrees). Angles are classified as acute (less than 90 degrees), right (exactly 90 degrees), obtuse (between 90 and 180 degrees), and straight (exactly 180 degrees).
rules: A line has no endpoints and extends in both directions
A ray has one endpoint and extends in one direction
A line segment has two endpoints
Perpendicular lines meet at 90 degrees (right angle)
Obtuse angle: more than 90 degrees but less than 180 degrees

questions.question_text: A line segment has:
questions.explanation_correct: A line segment is a part of a line with two definite endpoints.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A line segment has exactly two endpoints. Option A.

questions.question_text: A ray has:
questions.explanation_correct: A ray starts at one endpoint and extends infinitely in one direction.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A ray has exactly one endpoint. Option B.

questions.question_text: A line:

options.text: Extends in both directions without end

questions.explanation_correct: A line extends in both directions infinitely and has no endpoints.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A line has no endpoints and extends infinitely in both directions. Option C.

questions.question_text: Lines that never meet are called:
questions.explanation_correct: Parallel lines are lines that never intersect no matter how far they are extended.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Lines that never meet are called parallel lines. Option A.

questions.question_text: Lines that meet at a right angle (90 degrees) are called:
questions.explanation_correct: Perpendicular lines meet at exactly 90 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Lines meeting at 90 degrees are perpendicular lines. Option B.

questions.question_text: A right angle measures:
questions.explanation_correct: A right angle measures exactly 90 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A right angle = 90 degrees. Option B.

questions.question_text: An angle that is less than 90 degrees is called:
questions.explanation_correct: An acute angle measures less than 90 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: An angle less than 90 degrees is called acute. Option C.

questions.question_text: An angle that is more than 90 degrees but less than 180 degrees is called:
questions.explanation_correct: An obtuse angle measures more than 90 degrees but less than 180 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: An angle between 90 and 180 degrees is called obtuse. Option C.

questions.question_text: A straight angle measures:
questions.explanation_correct: A straight angle measures exactly 180 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A straight angle = 180 degrees. Option B.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is an example of parallel lines?

options.text: The two rails of a railway track
The hands of a clock at 3 o'clock

questions.explanation_correct: Railway tracks have two rails that run side by side and never meet - they are parallel.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Railway tracks are parallel lines. Option A.

questions.question_text: Which of the following shows perpendicular lines?
questions.explanation_correct: The letter L is formed by two lines meeting at a right angle (90 degrees), making them perpendicular.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The letter L shows two perpendicular lines meeting at 90 degrees. Option A.

questions.question_text: The angle formed by the hands of a clock at 3 o'clock is:
questions.explanation_correct: At 3 o'clock, the hour and minute hands form a 90-degree angle, which is a right angle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: At 3 o'clock, the hands form a 90-degree right angle. Option B.

questions.question_text: A torch beam is an example of a:
questions.explanation_correct: A torch beam starts at a fixed point (the torch) and extends in one direction, just like a ray.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A torch beam has one starting point and goes in one direction, like a ray. Option B.

questions.question_text: Which of these shows parallel lines?
questions.explanation_correct: The two long edges of a ruler are parallel - they are the same distance apart everywhere and never meet.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The edges of a ruler are parallel lines. Option A.

questions.question_text: The angle formed by the hands of a clock at 6 o'clock is:
questions.explanation_correct: At 6 o'clock, the hands point in opposite directions, forming a straight angle of 180 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: At 6 o'clock, the hands form a straight angle (180 degrees). Option D.

questions.question_text: A line segment can be measured, but a line cannot be measured. True or false?
questions.explanation_correct: True. A line segment has a definite length between its two endpoints. A line extends infinitely, so it cannot be measured.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A line segment has finite length. A line extends infinitely. True.

questions.question_text: The angle formed when you open a book slightly is most likely:
questions.explanation_correct: When a book is opened just slightly, the angle between the covers is small (less than 90 degrees), making it an acute angle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A slightly opened book forms an acute angle. Option A.

questions.question_text: The floor and a wall of a room are examples of:
questions.explanation_correct: The floor and wall of a room meet at a right angle (90 degrees), making them perpendicular.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The floor and wall meet at 90 degrees - perpendicular. Option B.

questions.question_text: The corner of a square has what type of angle?
questions.explanation_correct: Each corner of a square has a right angle (90 degrees).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Squares have right angles at all corners. Option B.

questions.question_text: Which lines are horizontal?

options.text: Lines going left to right (like the horizon)

questions.explanation_correct: Horizontal lines go from left to right, like the horizon.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Horizontal lines go left to right. Option A.

questions.question_text: Which lines are vertical?

options.text: Lines going up and down (straight up)

questions.explanation_correct: Vertical lines go straight up and down.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Vertical lines go up and down. Option B.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a real-life example of a line segment?

options.text: A laser beam going into space

questions.explanation_correct: The edge of a table has a definite starting point and ending point, just like a line segment.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A table edge has two endpoints, making it a line segment. Option A.

questions.question_text: The angle formed when you open an umbrella wide is most likely:
questions.explanation_correct: An umbrella opened wide forms an angle greater than 90 degrees between its ribs, making it an obtuse angle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A wide-open umbrella forms an obtuse angle. Option C.

questions.question_text: Which pair of lines in the letter H are parallel?
questions.explanation_correct: In the letter H, the two vertical lines on the sides are parallel to each other.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The two vertical strokes in H are parallel. Option A.

questions.question_text: An angle of 45 degrees is an acute angle. True or false?
questions.explanation_correct: True. 45 degrees is less than 90 degrees, so it is an acute angle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 45 < 90, so it is acute. True.

questions.question_text: The opposite edges of a blackboard are:
questions.explanation_correct: Opposite edges of a blackboard (top and bottom, or left and right) are parallel to each other.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Opposite edges of a rectangle are parallel. Option B.

questions.question_text: Sunlight coming through a window is an example of:
questions.explanation_correct: Sunlight comes from a source (the sun) and travels in one direction, similar to a ray.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Sunlight starts at the sun and goes in one direction, like a ray. Option B.

questions.question_text: The angle formed by the hands of a clock at 1 o'clock is:
questions.explanation_correct: At 1 o'clock, the angle between the hands is 30 degrees, which is less than 90 degrees - an acute angle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: At 1 o'clock, the angle is 30 degrees, which is acute. Option A.

questions.question_text: The letter T contains which types of lines?
questions.explanation_correct: The letter T is formed by a horizontal line and a vertical line meeting at a right angle - perpendicular lines.
questions.explanation_incorrect: In T, the horizontal and vertical lines meet at 90 degrees - perpendicular. Option B.

questions.question_text: How many right angles make a straight angle?
questions.explanation_correct: A straight angle = 180 degrees. A right angle = 90 degrees. 180 / 90 = 2.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 180 / 90 = 2 right angles make a straight angle. Option B.

questions.question_text: Which of these has no endpoints?
questions.explanation_correct: A line extends infinitely in both directions and has no endpoints.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A line has no endpoints. Option C.

questions.question_text: A horizontal line and a vertical line meeting at a point form:
questions.explanation_correct: A horizontal and vertical line meet at a right angle (90 degrees), making them perpendicular.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Horizontal and vertical lines meeting form perpendicular lines. Option B.

questions.question_text: The angle formed by the hands of a clock at 9 o'clock is:
questions.explanation_correct: At 9 o'clock, the angle between the hands is 90 degrees - a right angle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: At 9 o'clock, the hands form a 90-degree right angle. Option B.

questions.question_text: Parallel lines can sometimes meet if extended far enough. True or false?
questions.explanation_correct: False. By definition, parallel lines never meet no matter how far they are extended.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Parallel lines never meet, no matter how far extended. False.

questions.question_text: An angle of 120 degrees is:
questions.explanation_correct: 120 degrees is more than 90 degrees and less than 180 degrees, so it is an obtuse angle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 90 < 120 < 180, so it's obtuse. Option C.

questions.question_text: The edge of your pencil best represents a:
questions.explanation_correct: A pencil has a definite start and end, just like a line segment.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A pencil edge has two endpoints - a line segment. Option C.

questions.question_text: The rungs of a ladder are examples of:
questions.explanation_correct: The rungs are parallel to each other, and each rung is perpendicular to the side rails.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Rungs are parallel to each other and perpendicular to the sides. Both A and B. Option D.

questions.question_text: Which of the following angles is the smallest?
questions.explanation_correct: Acute < 90, Right = 90, Obtuse > 90, Straight = 180. Acute is the smallest.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Acute angles are less than 90 degrees, the smallest type. Option C.

questions.question_text: Which letter has both parallel and perpendicular lines?
questions.explanation_correct: The letter H has two parallel vertical lines and a horizontal line perpendicular to them.
questions.explanation_incorrect: H has parallel verticals and a perpendicular horizontal bar. Option A.

questions.question_text: The angle formed by the hands of a clock at 4 o'clock is:
questions.explanation_correct: At 4 o'clock, the angle = 4 x 30 = 120 degrees, which is obtuse.
questions.explanation_incorrect: At 4 o'clock, the angle is 120 degrees - obtuse. Option C.

questions.question_text: How many line segments does a triangle have?
questions.explanation_correct: A triangle is made up of 3 line segments (its 3 sides).
questions.explanation_incorrect: A triangle has 3 sides, which are 3 line segments. Option B.

questions.question_text: How many right angles are in a complete turn (full rotation)?
questions.explanation_correct: A complete turn = 360 degrees. 360 / 90 = 4 right angles.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 360 / 90 = 4 right angles in a full rotation. Option C.

questions.question_text: Zebra crossing stripes on a road are examples of:
questions.explanation_correct: The white stripes of a zebra crossing are equally spaced and never meet - they are parallel.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Zebra crossing stripes are parallel to each other. Option A.

questions.question_text: A line segment AB is ___ of a line.
questions.explanation_correct: A line segment is a part of a line between two points.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A line segment is a part of a line. Option A.

questions.question_text: An angle of 90 degrees is called an obtuse angle. True or false?
questions.explanation_correct: False. An angle of 90 degrees is called a right angle. Obtuse angles are between 90 and 180 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 90 degrees is a right angle, not obtuse. False.

questions.question_text: The plus sign (+) is formed by:
questions.explanation_correct: The plus sign (+) is formed by one horizontal and one vertical line crossing at right angles - perpendicular lines.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The + sign shows two perpendicular lines. Option B.

questions.question_text: The angle at the corner of a page of your textbook is:
questions.explanation_correct: The corners of a book page are right angles (90 degrees).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Book pages have right angle corners. Option B.

questions.question_text: How many line segments make a rectangle?
questions.explanation_correct: A rectangle has 4 sides, each of which is a line segment.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A rectangle has 4 line segments as its sides. Option B.

questions.question_text: The two long edges of a highway road are:
questions.explanation_correct: The two long edges of a straight highway are parallel - they are equally spaced apart and never meet.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Highway edges are parallel. Option B.

questions.question_text: The angle formed by the hands of a clock at 10 o'clock is:
questions.explanation_correct: At 10 o'clock, the angle between the hands is 60 degrees (the smaller angle), which is acute.
questions.explanation_incorrect: At 10 o'clock, the smaller angle is 60 degrees - acute. Option A.
